question.text: The electronic configuration of an element is <math> <mrow>  <msup>   <mrow>    <mtext>1s</mtext></mrow>   <mtext>2</mtext>  </msup>  <mtext>,</mtext><mtext> </mtext><msup>   <mrow>    <mtext>2s</mtext></mrow>   <mtext>2</mtext>  </msup>  <mtext>,</mtext><mtext> </mtext><msup>   <mrow>    <mtext>2p</mtext></mrow>   <mtext>6</mtext>  </msup>  <mtext>,</mtext><mtext> </mtext><msup>   <mrow>    <mtext>3s</mtext></mrow>   <mtext>2</mtext>  </msup>  <mtext>,</mtext><mtext> </mtext><msup>   <mrow>    <mtext>3p</mtext></mrow>   <mtext>3</mtext>  </msup>  </mrow></math>. What is the atomic number of the element, which is just below the above element in the periodic table?

solution.text: The electronic configuration of valence shell of element below the given element is <math><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></math> . But before the filling of 4p-orbitals start, the electrons enters the 3d-orbitals, which can accommodate 10 electrons. Hence, the electronic configuration of the element, which is just below the given element must be <math><mn>1</mn><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></math> . So its atomic number would be 33.
